data.title: Tinker Swiss Cottage Museum & Gardens
data.meta_description: Tinker Swiss Cottage Museum, Tinker Cottage
data.text:
Tour of Volunteerism

August 17th 10-11:30am

Join us for a chance to learn, tour and become a volunteer for three of Rockford’s historic house museums! On Saturday, August 17th from 10:00 AM – 11:30 AM, please join the Ethnic Heritage Museum Park, Swedish Historical Society, and Tinker Swiss Cottage for an opportunity to learn and explore three of Rockford’s historic house museums.

This will be an introduction to the Graham-Ginestra House, the Erlander Home Museum and Tinker Swiss Cottage.

Join current volunteers and staff of each location as we tour each facility and learn how to volunteer with each location! The tour begins at the Ethnic Heritage Museum Park, as both the Ethnic Heritage Museum and Graham Ginestra Home will be toured. Then it is a quick drive over to Tinker Swiss Cottage Museum for a tour of the Tinker Swiss Cottage. The final stop is at the Erlander Home Museum with a wrap-up presentation in the Nordic Cultural Center.

Maps will be given with all site locations, but please note that not all locations are ADA compliant.

This information packed day is a chance to explore, ask questions and find out how you can help volunteer and support the organizations that share parts of Rockford’s historic past!

If you are interested in attending, please RSVP to [email protected] or [email protected].

For more information on each of these locations, please visit:

www.swedishhistorical.org

www.tinkercottage.com

www.ethnicheritagemuseum.org

Speakeasy Murder Mystery Game Night

September 6th 6-8pm

Dust off your flapper dress, zoot suits and Tommy guns and get ready for your Roaring Twenties Murder Mystery Party! At the height of prohibition, morale was high, morals were at an all-time low, and most of the country was controlled by the Mafia.

At this cozy little hot spot, hidden in the old Tinker mansion, you will find the best night scene around. Drink, dance, sing and mingle with other like-minded individuals but be careful, wherever there is a speakeasy there is always the mafia…and the police. On a night like tonight, with tensions running high, you might get caught in the middle of a bloody dispute. Enjoy your night but keep your guard up, we’d hate to lose any of our clientele!

"The History of Beer in Rockford"

Summer Lecture

September 8th 2-4pm

We are excited to have Gary Patton join us for our 2024 summer lecture series! The presentation will consist of the history of brewing beer in the Rockford region.

Gary Patton is the creator of the Facebook group called "Rockford Made It". Gary started the group in 2018 to focus attention on all things made in Rockford, IL. Rockford Made It now consists of over 7,500 members, and Gary was featured in the Northwest Quarterly 2024 edition of "The 25 Most Interesting People".

Storytime at Tinker Cottage

September 10th 10:30am

Sign up HERE!

Crypts & Cocktails

Tipsy History at Greenwood Cemetery

September 20th 7-9pm

Join Tinker Swiss Cottage and the Community Foundation of Northern Illinois at the historic Greenwood Cemetery for a night of Tipsy History stories among the stones!

Participants will receive 3 drink tickets for this two-hour, 21+ event. Guests will walk around a portion of the cemetery as we tell a bit of unique Rockford history. Guests will also have the opportunity to tour the historic Greenwood Cemetery Chapel!

Cancelled

"American Cultures"

BSA Workshop

August 17th 10am-12pm

In this class, scouts will work towards their "American Cultures" Merit Badge. The United States is a nation of immigrants, and the blending of various cultural backgrounds is what has created our unique nation. Understanding cultural backgrounds can help Scouts to live in harmony with others in our varied and increasingly multicultural society.

​In this class, Scouts will complete 4 out of 5 requirements for the badge. In order to complete the final badge requirement, Scouts will need to share what they learned at their next Den/Troop meeting. ​

Paranormal Tour w/ The Paranormal Moms Society

August 17th 7-10pm

Tinker Swiss Cottage Museum is excited to welcome back our friends from the Paranormal Moms Society!

Join us for scintillating tales from paranormal experts, listen to audio clips found in the Tinker Cottage, and enjoy a tour with the chance to have your own paranormal encounter. You are welcome and encouraged to bring your own equipment (cameras, camcorders, audio recorders, emf). Each event begins in the Barn.

Robert Tinker's Downtown

Walking Tour

August 24th 10-11:30am

Welcome to Robert Tinker's World! Join Tinker Swiss Cottage as we follow in the footsteps of former Rockford Mayor and Park District Commissioner, Robert Hall Tinker and his family.

​We will see the exterior of many of the homes, businesses, and public buildings that the Tinker family enjoyed visiting while they inhabited the Swiss Cottage. Along the way you will learn to recognize a number of different architectural styles and deepen your knowledge of history regarding the Forest City.

Come see downtown Rockford through the eyes of the Victorians on August 24th from 10-11:30am!

Tours start and end at the Rockford Park District Webbs Norman Center (). For those interested, please join us afterwards at Rockford Roasting Company for specialty "Tinker" beverages available for purchase.

This is an approximately 1.5-mile walking tour with some uneven ground. Please wear appropriate walking shoes to this event.

Paranormal Investigation & Paranormal Conference

September 13-14

Tinker Swiss Cottage Museum and Gardens; Veterans Memorial Hall; and Haunted Rockford Paranormal Events are proud to present the 2024 Illinois Paranormal Conference!

Special Paranormal Investigation at Tinker Swiss Cottage Museum on Friday the 13th. Conference on Saturday the 14th.

Join speakers and vendors from all aspects of paranormal research. Featured speaker this year will be well-know paranormal investigator and medium Chris Fleming. Other speakers will include Spiritualist Eve Harker; Lili and Vanessa from the Haunted Happy Hour Podcast; Jaci and Bill Kousoulas of Phenomenology Research Professionals; and Paul Schmidt of the Illinois Paranormalists.

"Tinkering with Art"

​Girl Scout Daisy Badge Workshop

September 14th 10am-12pm

Art and design are all around! Join us at Tinker Swiss Cottage Museum for this hands-on study of art.

With this lesson plan, Tinker Swiss Cottage is able to accommodate all of the requirements to earn this badge. (Please note, the museum does not provide the physical badges.)

​

Badge purpose: Find out how to be a maker to turn ideas into art and to solve problems with design.

Fairy Tale Tea Party

September 21st

11am-12:30pm

Calling all princesses, princes and creatures of all kinds!

Are you looking for an afternoon fit for the whole family?

Tinker Swiss Cottage is excited to welcome Princesses from Characters 2 Life for this special Victorian Tea Pary! This 3- course lunch will be followed by a tour of the Tinker Swiss Cottage.

This event is sponsored by Characters 2 Life, Nothing Bundt Cakes, and Schnucks. Be sure to join in the fun of this special family friendly event!

Tickets to this event are limited, so get yours today!
